result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia or any items for growing, packaging or harvesting of illegal drugs.

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik A. Kampa appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court as a friend of the court for Erik A. Kampa. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $5000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
